9. Probabilitc Reasoning (3)

Approximate Inference

  • Monte Carlo algorithmsëŠ” ìƒì„±ëœ ìƒ˜í”Œ ìˆ˜ì— ë”°ë¼ ì •í™•ë„ê°€ ë‹¬ë¼ì§€ëŠ” ê·¼ì‚¬ì ì¸ (approximate) í•´ë‹µì„ ì œê³µ
    • Monte Carlo algorithmsëŠ” ì •í™•í•œ ê³„ì‚°ì´ ì–´ë ¤ìš´ ì–‘ì„ ì¶”ì •í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•´ ë§ì€ ê³¼í•™ ë¶„ì•¼ì—ì„œ ì‚¬ìš©
  • Bayes netì˜ í™•ë¥ ì„ ê¸°ë°˜ìœ¼ë¡œ ëœë¤ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ë¥¼ ìƒì„±í•˜ê³ , ì´ ëœë¤ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ì—ì„œ ë°œê²¬ëœ ë‹¤ì–‘í•œ í•´ë‹µì„ ê³„ì‚°í•˜ì—¬ ì‘ë™
    • ì¶©ë¶„í•œ ìƒ˜í”Œì„ í†µí•´, ì°¸ í™•ë¥  ë¶„í¬ (true probability distribution)ë¥¼ ì„ì˜ë¡œ ê°€ê¹ê²Œ ë³µêµ¬í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ
    • P(Xâˆ£e)P(X|e)P(Xâˆ£e)ì™€ ê°™ì€ Bayes netì˜ ì‚¬í›„ í™•ë¥  (posterior probabilities) ê³„ì‚°ì— ì ìš©ë˜ëŠ” ìƒ˜í”Œë§ì— ê´€ì‹¬

Direct Sampling Methods

Notations

    • ì´ëŸ¬í•œ ì¶”ì •ì¹˜ (estimate)ëŠ” ì¼ê´€ì  (consistent)ì´ë¼ê³  í•¨
    • ì˜ˆ: mâ‰¤nm \le nmâ‰¤nì¸ ë¶€ë¶„ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ì§€ì •ëœ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ x1,â€¦,xmx_1, \ldots, x_mx1â€‹,â€¦,xmâ€‹ì˜ í™•ë¥ ì— ëŒ€í•œ ì¼ê´€ì  ì¶”ì •ì¹˜ë¥¼ ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ì´ ìƒì„±í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ

Rejection Sampling

  • Rejection sampling (ê¸°ê° ìƒ˜í”Œë§)ì€ ì‰½ê²Œ ìƒ˜í”Œë§í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ” ë¶„í¬ê°€ ì£¼ì–´ì¡Œì„ ë•Œ ìƒ˜í”Œë§í•˜ê¸° ì–´ë ¤ìš´ ë¶„í¬ì—ì„œ ìƒ˜í”Œì„ ìƒì„±í•˜ëŠ” ì¼ë°˜ì ì¸ ë°©ë²•.
    • ì¡°ê±´ë¶€ í™•ë¥  P(Xâˆ£e)P(X|e)P(Xâˆ£e)ë¥¼ ê³„ì‚°í•˜ëŠ” ë° ì‚¬ìš©ë  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ
  • ì‘ë™ ë°©ì‹
    1. ë¨¼ì €, ë„¤íŠ¸ì›Œí¬ì— ì˜í•´ ì§€ì •ëœ ì‚¬ì „ ë¶„í¬ (prior distribution)ì—ì„œ ìƒ˜í”Œì„ ìƒì„±
    2. ê·¸ëŸ° ë‹¤ìŒ, ì¦ê±° eeeì™€ ì¼ì¹˜í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ” ëª¨ë“  ìƒ˜í”Œì„ ê¸°ê° (reject)
    3. ë§ˆì§€ë§‰ìœ¼ë¡œ, P^(X=xâˆ£e)\hat{P}(X=x|e)P^(X=xâˆ£e) ì¶”ì •ì¹˜ëŠ” ë‚¨ì•„ìˆëŠ” ìƒ˜í”Œì—ì„œ X=xX=xX=xê°€ ë°œìƒí•˜ëŠ” íšŸìˆ˜ë¥¼ ì„¸ì–´ ì–»ìŒ
  • ì¶”ì • ë¶„í¬ P^(Xâˆ£e)\hat{P}(X|e)P^(Xâˆ£e)ëŠ” ì¦ê±° eeeì™€ ì¼ì¹˜í•˜ëŠ” XXXì˜ ê° ê°’ì— ëŒ€í•œ ìƒ˜í”Œ íšŸìˆ˜ ë²¡í„° NPS(X,e)N_{PS}(X, e)NPSâ€‹(X,e)ë¥¼ ì •ê·œí™”í•˜ì—¬ ê³„ì‚°
    • P^(Xâˆ£e)=Î±NPS(X,e)=NPS(X,e)NPS(e)\hat{P}(X|e) = \alpha N_{PS}(X, e) = \frac{N_{PS}(X, e)}{N_{PS}(e)}P^(Xâˆ£e)=Î±NPSâ€‹(X,e)=NPSâ€‹(e)NPSâ€‹(X,e)â€‹
    • P(x1,â€¦,xm)â‰ˆNPS(x1,â€¦,xm)/NP(x_1, \ldots, x_m) \approx N_{PS}(x_1, \ldots, x_m) / NP(x1â€‹,â€¦,xmâ€‹)â‰ˆNPSâ€‹(x1â€‹,â€¦,xmâ€‹)/Në¡œë¶€í„°, ë‹¤ìŒì´ ë¨
      • P^(Xâˆ£e)â‰ˆP(X,e)P(e)=P(Xâˆ£e)\hat{P}(X|e) \approx \frac{P(X, e)}{P(e)} = P(X|e)P^(Xâˆ£e)â‰ˆP(e)P(X,e)â€‹=P(Xâˆ£e)
  • Rejection sampling ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜
function REJECTION-SAMPLING(X, e, bn, N) returns an estimate of P(X | e)
inputs: X, the query variable
        e, observed values for variables E
        bn, a Bayesian network
        N, the total number of samples to be generated
local variables: C, a vector of counts for each value of X, initially zero

for j = 1 to N do
    x â† PRIOR-SAMPLE(bn)
    if x is consistent with e then
        C[j] â† C[j]+1 where x_j is the value of X in x
return NORMALIZE(C)

Challenges in Rejection Sampling

  • Rejection samplingì˜ ë³µì¡ì„±ì€ ì£¼ë¡œ ìˆ˜ìš©ë˜ëŠ” (accepted) ìƒ˜í”Œì˜ ë¹„ìœ¨ì— ë”°ë¼ ë‹¬ë¼ì§€ë©°, ì´ ë¹„ìœ¨ì€ ì •í™•íˆ ì¦ê±°ì˜ ì‚¬ì „ í™•ë¥  P(e)P(e)P(e)ì™€ ê°™ìŒ
  • ë³µì¡í•œ ë¬¸ì œì˜ ê²½ìš°, ë§ì€ ì¦ê±° ë³€ìˆ˜ (evidence variables)ê°€ ìˆìœ¼ë©´ ì´ ë¹„ìœ¨ì€ ë§¤ìš° ì‘ì•„ì§ (vanishingly small)
    • ì´ëŠ” ëŒ€ë¶€ë¶„ì˜ ìƒ˜í”Œì´ ê¸°ê°ë˜ì–´ ì¶”ì •ì„ ìœ„í•œ ìœ íš¨ ìƒ˜í”Œì´ ê±°ì˜ ë‚¨ì§€ ì•Šê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì— Rejection samplingì˜ ì•½ì 

Importance Sampling

  • Importance sampling (ì¤‘ìš”ë„ ìƒ˜í”Œë§)ì€ ë˜ ë‹¤ë¥¸ ë¶„í¬ QQQë¡œë¶€í„°ì˜ ìƒ˜í”Œì„ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ì—¬ ë¶„í¬ PPPë¡œë¶€í„° ìƒ˜í”Œë§í•˜ëŠ” íš¨ê³¼ë¥¼ ëª¨ë°©í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì„ ëª©í‘œë¡œ í•¨
    • ê° ìƒ˜í”Œ xxxë¥¼ ì…€ ë•Œ P(x)Q(x)\frac{P(x)}{Q(x)}Q(x)P(x)â€‹ (weight, ê°€ì¤‘ì¹˜ë¼ê³ ë„ í•¨)ì¸ ë³´ì • ê³„ìˆ˜ (correction factor)ë¥¼ ì ìš©í•˜ì—¬ í•´ë‹µì´ ê·¹í•œì—ì„œ ì •í™•í•¨ì„ ë³´ì¥
    • ì‹¤ì œë¡œëŠ” ë„ˆë¬´ ì–´ë ¤ì›Œì„œ ì¦ê±°ì— ì¡°ê±´í™”ëœ ì°¸ ì‚¬í›„ ë¶„í¬ P(zâˆ£e)P(z|e)P(zâˆ£e)ì—ì„œ ì§ì ‘ ìƒ˜í”Œë§í•˜ëŠ” ëŒ€ì‹ , ì‰¬ìš´ ë¶„í¬ì—ì„œ ìƒ˜í”Œë§í•˜ê³  í•„ìš”í•œ ë³´ì • (corrections)ì„ ì ìš©
  • Importance sampling ì‘ë™ ì›ë¦¬:
    • ë¹„ì¦ê±° ë³€ìˆ˜ (nonevidence variables)ë¥¼ ZZZë¼ê³  ê°€ì • P(zâˆ£e)P(z|e)P(zâˆ£e)ì—ì„œ ì§ì ‘ ìƒ˜í”Œë§í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆë‹¤ë©´ ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ì´ ì¶”ì •ì¹˜ë¥¼ êµ¬ì„±í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ
      • P^(zâˆ£e)=NP(z)Nâ‰ˆP(zâˆ£e)\hat{P}(z|e) = \frac{N_P(z)}{N} \approx P(z|e)P^(zâˆ£e)=NNPâ€‹(z)â€‹â‰ˆP(zâˆ£e), ì—¬ê¸°ì„œ NP(z)N_P(z)NPâ€‹(z)ëŠ” PPPë¡œë¶€í„° ìƒ˜í”Œë§í–ˆì„ ë•Œ Z=zZ=zZ=zì¸ ìƒ˜í”Œ ìˆ˜
    • ëŒ€ì‹  Q(z)Q(z)Q(z)ì—ì„œ ìƒ˜í”Œë§í•œë‹¤ê³  ê°€ì •í•˜ë©´, ì¶”ì •ì¹˜ëŠ” ë³´ì • ê³„ìˆ˜ë¥¼ í¬í•¨
      • P^(zâˆ£e)=NQ(z)Nâ‹…P(zâˆ£e)Q(z)â‰ˆQ(z)P(zâˆ£e)Q(z)=P(zâˆ£e)\hat{P}(z|e) = \frac{N_Q(z)}{N} \cdot \frac{P(z|e)}{Q(z)} \approx Q(z) \frac{P(z|e)}{Q(z)} = P(z|e)P^(zâˆ£e)=NNQâ€‹(z)â€‹â‹…Q(z)P(zâˆ£e)â€‹â‰ˆQ(z)Q(z)P(zâˆ£e)â€‹=P(zâˆ£e)
    • ë”°ë¼ì„œ, ì‚¬ìš©ë˜ëŠ” ìƒ˜í”Œë§ ë¶„í¬ QQQì™€ ê´€ê³„ì—†ì´ ì¶”ì •ì¹˜ëŠ” ì˜¬ë°”ë¥¸ ê°’ìœ¼ë¡œ ìˆ˜ë ´ (ë‹¨, P(zâˆ£e)P(z|e)P(zâˆ£e)ê°€ 0ì´ ì•„ë‹Œ ëª¨ë“  zzzì— ëŒ€í•´ Q(z)Q(z)Q(z)ëŠ” 0ì´ ì•„ë‹ˆì–´ì•¼ í•¨)
  • ë³´ì • ê³„ìˆ˜ëŠ” ê³¼ëŒ€ ìƒ˜í”Œë§ (oversampling) ë˜ëŠ” ê³¼ì†Œ ìƒ˜í”Œë§ (undersampling)ì„ ë³´ìƒ
  • ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ê¸° ì‰¬ìš°ë©´ì„œë„ ì°¸ ì‚¬í›„ ë¶„í¬ P(zâˆ£e)P(z|e)P(zâˆ£e)ì— ìµœëŒ€í•œ ê°€ê¹Œìš´ QQQë¥¼ ì›í•¨ ê°€ì¥ ì¼ë°˜ì ì¸ ì ‘ê·¼ ë°©ì‹ì€ Likelihood weighting

Likelihood Weighting

  • Likelihood weighting (ìš°ë„ ê°€ì¤‘) ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ì€ ì¦ê±° ë³€ìˆ˜ EEEì˜ ê°’ì„ ê³ ì •í•˜ê³ , ëª¨ë“  ë¹„ì¦ê±° ë³€ìˆ˜ë¥¼ ìœ„ìƒ ì •ë ¬ ìˆœì„œë¡œ ìƒ˜í”Œë§í•˜ë©°, ê° ë³€ìˆ˜ëŠ” ë¶€ëª¨ì— ì¡°ê±´í™”ë¨
    • ì´ ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ì— ì˜í•´ ìƒì„±ëœ ìƒ˜í”Œë§ ë¶„í¬ë¥¼ QLWQ_{LW}QLWâ€‹ë¼ê³  í•¨ ë¹„ì¦ê±° ë³€ìˆ˜ê°€ Z={Z1,â€¦,Zk}Z = \{Z_1, \ldots, Z_k\}Z={Z1â€‹,â€¦,Zkâ€‹}ì¸ ê²½ìš°, QLW(z)=Î i=1kP(ziâˆ£parents(Zi))Q_{LW}(z) = \Pi_{i=1}^k P(z_i | \text{parents}(Z_i))QLWâ€‹(z)=Î i=1kâ€‹P(ziâ€‹âˆ£parents(Ziâ€‹))
    • P^(zâˆ£e)=NLW(z)Nâ‹…P(zâˆ£e)QLW(z)=NLW(z)Nâ‹…w(z)\hat{P}(z|e) = \frac{N_{LW}(z)}{N} \cdot \frac{P(z|e)}{Q_{LW}(z)} = \frac{N_{LW}(z)}{N} \cdot w(z)P^(zâˆ£e)=NNLWâ€‹(z)â€‹â‹…QLWâ€‹(z)P(zâˆ£e)â€‹=NNLWâ€‹(z)â€‹â‹…w(z)
  • ê° ìƒ˜í”Œì— ëŒ€í•´ QLWQ_{LW}QLWâ€‹ë¡œë¶€í„° ìƒì„±ëœ ê°€ì¤‘ì¹˜ w(z)w(z)w(z)ë¥¼ ê³„ì‚°í•´ì•¼ í•¨
    • ê°€ì¤‘ì¹˜ëŠ” w(z)=P(zâˆ£e)QLW(z)=Î±P(z,e)QLW(z)w(z) = \frac{P(z|e)}{Q_{LW}(z)} = \alpha \frac{P(z, e)}{Q_{LW}(z)}w(z)=QLWâ€‹(z)P(zâˆ£e)â€‹=Î±QLWâ€‹(z)P(z,e)â€‹ë¡œ ì •ì˜ë¨
    • P(z,e)P(z, e)P(z,e)ëŠ” Bayes netì—ì„œ zzzì™€ eeeì˜ ê²°í•© í™•ë¥ 
    • w(z)=Î±Î i=1kP(ziâˆ£parents(Zi))Î j=1mP(ejâˆ£parents(Ej))Î i=1kP(ziâˆ£parents(Zi))=Î±Î j=1mP(ejâˆ£parents(Ej))w(z) = \alpha \frac{\Pi_{i=1}^k P(z_i | \text{parents}(Z_i)) \Pi_{j=1}^m P(e_j | \text{parents}(E_j))}{\Pi_{i=1}^k P(z_i | \text{parents}(Z_i))} = \alpha \Pi_{j=1}^m P(e_j | \text{parents}(E_j))w(z)=Î±Î i=1kâ€‹P(ziâ€‹âˆ£parents(Ziâ€‹))Î i=1kâ€‹P(ziâ€‹âˆ£parents(Ziâ€‹))Î j=1mâ€‹P(ejâ€‹âˆ£parents(Ejâ€‹))â€‹=Î±Î j=1mâ€‹P(ejâ€‹âˆ£parents(Ejâ€‹))
  • ê°€ì¤‘ì¹˜ëŠ” ë¶€ëª¨ê°€ ì£¼ì–´ì§„ ì¦ê±° ë³€ìˆ˜ë“¤ì˜ ì¡°ê±´ë¶€ í™•ë¥  (conditional probabilities)ì˜ ê³±
    • ì¦ê±°ì˜ í™•ë¥ ì€ ì¼ë°˜ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ìš°ë„ (likelihoods)ë¼ê³  ë¶ˆë¦¬ë¯€ë¡œ, Likelihood weightingì´ë¼ëŠ” ì´ë¦„ì´ ë¶™ìŒ
  • Likelihood weighting ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜
function LIKELIHOOD-WEIGHTING(X, e, bn, N) returns an estimate of P(X | e)
inputs: X, the query variable
        e, observed values for variables E
        bn, a Bayesian network specifying joint distribution P(X_1,...,X_n)
        N, the total number of samples to be generated
local variables: W, a vector of weighted counts for each value of X, initially zero

for j = 1 to N do
    x, w â† WEIGHTED-SAMPLE(bn, e)
    W[j] â† W[j]+w where x_j is the value of X in x
return NORMALIZE(W)

function WEIGHTED-SAMPLE(bn, e) returns an event and a weight
    w â† 1; x â† an event with n elements, with values fixed from e
    for i = 1 to n do
        if X_i is an evidence variable with value x_i_j in e
            then w â† w Ã— P(x_i_j | parents(X_i))
        else x[i] â† a random sample from P(X_i | parents(X_i))
    return x, w

Lawn Condition Example

  • Query: P(Rainâˆ£Cloudy=true,WetGrass=true)P(\text{Rain} | \text{Cloudy} = true, \text{WetGrass} = true)P(Rainâˆ£Cloudy=true,WetGrass=true)
  • Process ì˜ˆì‹œ:
    1. ê°€ì¤‘ì¹˜ wwwë¥¼ 1.01.01.0ìœ¼ë¡œ ì„¤ì •

  • ê²°ê³¼: ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ [true,false,true,true][true, false, true, true][true,false,true,true]ëŠ” ê°€ì¤‘ì¹˜ 0.450.450.45ë¥¼ ê°€ì§€ë©°, Rain = TrueTrueTrueë¡œ ì§‘ê³„

Pros and Cons of Likelihood Weighting

  • Likelihood weightingì€ ìƒì„±ëœ ëª¨ë“  ìƒ˜í”Œì„ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì— Rejection samplingë³´ë‹¤ í›¨ì”¬ íš¨ìœ¨ì ì¼ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ

    • ëŒ€ë¶€ë¶„ì˜ ìƒ˜í”Œì´ ë§¤ìš° ë‚®ì€ ê°€ì¤‘ì¹˜ë¥¼ ê°€ì§€ë¯€ë¡œ, ê°€ì¤‘ì¹˜ê°€ ë¶€ì—¬ëœ ì¶”ì •ì¹˜ëŠ” ì¦ê±°ì— ê·¹íˆ ë¯¸ë¯¸í•œ ìš°ë„ë¥¼ ë¶€ì—¬í•˜ëŠ” ì•„ì£¼ ì‘ì€ ë¹„ìœ¨ì˜ ìƒ˜í”Œì— ì˜í•´ ì§€ë°°ë˜ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸
    • w(z)=Î±Î i=1mP(eiâˆ£parents(Ei))w(z) = \alpha \Pi_{i=1}^m P(e_i | \text{parents}(E_i))w(z)=Î±Î i=1mâ€‹P(eiâ€‹âˆ£parents(Eiâ€‹))

Python Programming for Bayesian Networks

  • model.py, likelihood.py, inference.py, sample.py íŒŒì¼ì˜ ë‚´ìš© ì œì‹œ

likelihood.py

  • Query ì˜ˆì‹œ:

P(R=none,M=no,T=onÂ time,A=attend)P(R=none, M=no, T=on~time, A=attend) P(R=none,M=no,T=onÂ time,A=attend)

=P(R=none)P(M=noâˆ£R=none)= P(R=none) P(M=no | R=none) =P(R=none)P(M=noâˆ£R=none)

P(T=onÂ timeâˆ£R=none,M=no)P(A=attendâˆ£T=onÂ time)P(T=on~time | R=none, M=no) P(A=attend | T=on~time) P(T=onÂ timeâˆ£R=none,M=no)P(A=attendâˆ£T=onÂ time)

=0.7Ã—0.6Ã—0.9Ã—0.9=0.3402= 0.7 \times 0.6 \times 0.9 \times 0.9 = 0.3402 =0.7Ã—0.6Ã—0.9Ã—0.9=0.3402

inference.py

  • Verification by example
    • P(rain=noneâˆ£train=delayed)=Î±P(rain=none,train=delayed)=0.46â€¦P(\text{rain} = none | \text{train} = delayed) = \alpha P(\text{rain} = none, \text{train} = delayed) = 0.46 \ldotsP(rain=noneâˆ£train=delayed)=Î±P(rain=none,train=delayed)=0.46â€¦
    • P(rain=lightâˆ£train=delayed)=Î±P(rain=light,train=delayed)=0.30â€¦P(\text{rain} = light | \text{train} = delayed) = \alpha P(\text{rain} = light, \text{train} = delayed) = 0.30 \ldotsP(rain=lightâˆ£train=delayed)=Î±P(rain=light,train=delayed)=0.30â€¦
    • P(rain=heavyâˆ£train=delayed)=Î±P(rain=heavy,train=delayed)=0.23â€¦P(\text{rain} = heavy | \text{train} = delayed) = \alpha P(\text{rain} = heavy, \text{train} = delayed) = 0.23 \ldotsP(rain=heavyâˆ£train=delayed)=Î±P(rain=heavy,train=delayed)=0.23â€¦
